text: I feel like I bond easily with others and form close emotional connections quickly.
I tend to avoid getting too close to others because I'm afraid of being hurt or rejected.
I feel like I cling to my partner or close relationships, fearing they might leave me.
I tend to detach emotionally from relationships when things get too intense or complicated.
I feel comfortable with intimacy and can maintain close relationships without feeling overwhelmed.
I worry that my partner doesn't really love me or will abandon me.
I prefer to keep relationships casual and avoid deep emotional commitments.
I feel like I need constant reassurance from my partner to feel secure in the relationship.
I can maintain healthy boundaries in relationships while still being emotionally connected.
I feel like I'm too dependent on my partner and can't function well without them.
I can trust my partner and don't constantly worry about them leaving or betraying me.
I feel like I push people away when they try to get too close to me emotionally.
I can balance my need for closeness with my need for independence in relationships.
I feel anxious when my partner is away or when I don't know where they are.
I can form secure attachments and maintain healthy, stable relationships.
I feel like I'm always trying to avoid getting hurt, so I keep people at a distance.
I experience intense fear of abandonment and do everything I can to prevent my partner from leaving.
I feel like I detach emotionally when relationships become too demanding or stressful.
I can maintain my own identity and interests while being in a close relationship.
I feel secure in my relationships and don't constantly worry about how I bond, avoid, cling, or detach.
